comment: The plan s tarted with this move wasn't all clear to me at that very moment. I somehow felt I must be pushing on the queen side and in the center but did not yet see any exact goals. I was lucky to find a relatively straightforward way to win anyway. Now for the plan: black tries to occupy d4 with a piece (preferably knight) and to take the control over the opened c-file. At the same time the weak a4-pawn is constantly being threatened so white is kept busy. Black does not avoid exchanges since even with relatively few peaces the control of the opened line and the penetration with the rook on the seventh rank bring easily serious advantages.
